articles.title: 2024 6æœˆ ä¸­æ–‡
articles.content:
Music:

Big band Performance @ Derby Square, Salem. 2024. June. 8 (Salem Arts Festival)

5 horns arranging - how high the moon:

Piano practice routine (progress excel)

Weekly tasks:

  • chords: 2 key tension memorize - odd day LH, even day RH

  • scales: 2 keyÂ  dorian, lydian memorize- odd day LH, even day RH

    • diatonic chords and inversion

  • Techniques: 2 key 3 minor scales/ arpeggios/ chord progressions

  • circle of 5th, RH and then LH. (Bb, Eb, Ab, Db, Gb)

    • Monday: major & inversion

    • Tuesday: minor & inversions

    • Wednesday: dominantÂ 

    • Thur: half diminished

    • friday: half diminished

    • Sat: dominant

    • Sun: diminished

  • circle of 2-5 , RH and then LH(stride, root + voicing). metronome: 50

    • A voicing (odd day)

    • B voicing (even day)

  • Voicing & other chord progression practice (2 keys per week)

    • Triads (3m)Â 

      • major, minor, dimished, augmented

    • Shell voicing (major, dominant, minor), RH and then LH

    • 251 workout with inversion RH -> LH:

      • guide tone

      • close positionÂ 

      • A position voicingÂ 

      • B position voicingÂ 

    • simple form blues (Sing melody then play) (Bb odd week;Â  F even week):

      • Ireal pro:

        • comping:Â 

          • guide tone

          • 4Â  way close form, with inversion

          • 9, 13 formÂ 

        • Groove:

          • from simple - use rhythmic notation chapter. one week one chapterÂ 

        • solo: blues scale

  • Dedicated song:Â 

    • relate to listening project (sunday use midi to record, use logic pro to print score)

    • preprare cyn recitals, 2 songs per week

      • intro

      • head

      • solo ( blues, scales, jazz appegio)

      • outro

      • Mon- Wed

        • someday my prince will come

        • how insensitive

        • all of me

        • take 5

      • Thurs-Sun

        • How high the moon

        • misty

        • close to you

        • blues for alice

    • Comping (treat it as final exam of the Comp2)

      • LH: walking bass + RH: Comping

      • Both hand spread voicing

      • practice single chord by chord- important

        • LH repeated walking bass

        • RH different comping voicing: 9,13th for dominant, & 4 stacksï¼Œ this need to practice each bar with single chord

      • LH walking bass + RH melody

      • LH walking bass + RH comping

  • Sight reading songs:Â 

    • sight readingÂ  3 é¦–

  • recitals (2 songs a week)

Monday - Wednesday

  • The Well-Tempered Clavier + Fugue in C major

  • Black Key Etude

  • Canon in D

  • Attack on Titan

Thursday - Sunday

  • 2 chopin Nocturnes

  • Waltz in A minor, Sonata in C major

  • Secret, River Flows in You

  • Interstellar, La La Land, Experience

  • transpose:

    • chord progression anlysisÂ 

    • transpose to C, F, G

  • listen project

    • jazz phrase book (2,5,1)

Â 

  • Composition practice

    • Composition 1 (30min, write down in the note book)

    • melody

    • chord

    • reharm using melody (whats the chord that include that melody)

    • adjust the rhythm

      • bossa

      • swing

      • 3/4

      • walking bass

  • ET

    • ear master (ä¸€å‘¨ä¸€ä¸ªmodule, åå¤ç»ƒé€Ÿåº¦. )

      • Interval 12

      • chord 9

Â 

Habit maintain

articles.title: Arranging1 - Alex Clements
articles.content:
Melody transformation:

Anticipation is a form of syncopation using rhythms, notes, or chords to lead into a down beat. The anticipation occurs most commonly through use of an eighth, sixteenth, or quarter note. As a result, the anticipated note becomes naturally more accented. Consider the meaning of the word "anticipation." Certain notes will occur slightly before the beat, creating a syncopation of the basic rhythm. Another term that is sometimes used for an anticipation is a push. The anticipation or syncopation style can be traced back to the ragtime style. Ragtime (

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QTQQAWCqytE

)took traditional marches, added anticipations, and syncopated the beat. Listeners said the music sounded "ragged," hence the term ragtime. Songs like "The Entertainer" and "Maple Leaf Rag" are some of the signature songs of this style.

Two rules apply to create an eighth note anticipation:

  1. The note must occur on the "up" part of the beat.

  2. The note must be followed by a tie or a rest.

articles.title: Harmony 3 -Randy Pingrey
articles.content:
Recommendation from randy

listen to as much jazz music as you can and listen to a few of your favorite jazz recordings very, very deeply.Â  Sing along, play along, listen constantly.

Learn tunes, too.Â  The classic Great American Songbook standards.Â  Be able to play them without sheet music and without the chord changes.Â  And learn a tune in all 12 keys as soon as you can - use what you learned in HR3 to help you!

Diatonic functioning chord scales

Big picture

  • chords scale (extended chord structures) = chord tones + tensions + avoided note (can be approach notes, which means neighbor tones or passing tones)

    • diatonic (tonal)

    • non-diatonic

Why do we need to know chord scales?

  • to identify the available pitches for chords in a functional context.

  • i.e. to construct harmony

  • i.e. to construct a melody

What are the categories of chord scales? - need to do harmonic analysis first

  • Major key chord scales

    • diatonic - 7 modes

    • secondary dominant (normal & optional, which included altered dominant scale, symmetric dominant scales)

    • extended dominant

    • related II-7 and related II-7b5

    • modal interchange

      • distinguish b/w modal source (C major & C minor)& chord scale (C lydian chord)

      • major - lydian

      • minor - dorian

      • dominant - lydian + b7

      • -7b5 - locrian

  • Minor key chord scales

    • natural minor, dorian, phyrigian, melodic minor, harmonic minor

  • blues chord scales (guide tone line)

What are the composing strategies?

Modes chord scales (diatonic)

Ionian

Dorian

phrygian

Lydian

mixolydian (sus4)

Aeolian

Locrian

articles.title: LH Bass techniques - ILPN225 (Patrick Bianchi)
articles.content:
In simple â†’ complex order

  1. LH walking bass line (continuous quarter notes)

    1. simple approach

      1. 1 & 3 beats â†’ strong beats using CHORD TONES

      2. 2 & 4 beats

        1. diatonic approach note

        2. chromatic approach

        3. intervallic (diatonic to the chord)

        4. repeat previous note

    2. simple approach + favor

      1. if its a dominant chord: bebop scales

      2. embellishment

        1. enclosure approach: upper â†’ lower â†’ resolve to CHORD TONES

        2. arpeggios

  2. LH groove/patten bassline (based on songs)

    1. bossa nova grove (1, 5)

    2. songs: road song, sidewinder

  3. LH Improvisation bassline (broken bassline & add rhythmic favor)

    1. simple approach + 8th, 16th notes & syncopation (e.g., freddie freeloader - ray brown)

    2. add triplet (target chord tone) - bass line goes down, and triplet goes up

    3. add ghost note one beat 1, 2, 3, 4

    4. add syncopation & broken tripletâ†’ more funky flavor

    5. odd rhythm bassline

  4. RH comping voicing

    1. single chords: 4th stack comping

      1. major chords: lydian

      2. minor chords: dorian

      3. dominant chords: mixo & AB voicing (9, 13)

    2. use a) to create multiple chord direction (go up or down using 4th chords in dorian for example)

    3. use whole tone scales to create multiple chord direction (go up or down using 4th chords in whole tone for passing chords)

    4. use sus chords and circle of fifth as passing chords

Get to Do

To summarize

  1. understandÂ the theory(I've done)

  1. listen to recordingsÂ for bass player - transcribe the bass and understand what they are doing by using the theory (e.g., which scales? what embellishments? what rhythm change? when and how changed from walking bass to 2 feel or funky feel?) - so like a preparedÂ solo

  1. apply it to blues (simple form 12 bars blues) without writing out

  1. apply it to jazz standard you already know well (simple form 12 bars blues) without writing out

  1. apply to a new song when you first encounter.

Practice method

In order to create the improvised bass solo, you have to memorize the chords change first!

  1. independent rhythmic training

    1. metronome on every 2, 4 beats

    2. metronome on 2nd beat

    3. metronome on 3rd beat

    4. metronome on 4th beat

  2. triplet swing feel exercise over blues

    1. LH uses 4 different pattern

      1. 1111

      2. 1185

      3. 1151

      4. 1365

    2. RH same note but in different beat (2, 3, 8, 16 subdivision)

      1. comping displacement

        1. attack on beat 1, and of beat1â€¦..

        2. 6 over 4.

        3. broken 6 over 4

    3. quarter note displacement

      1. downbeat

      2. upbeat 3rd triplet

      3. 2nd triple

      4. even 8th notes

  3. improvisation of bass line

    1. think of the shape of the bass line (as its a slow solo of the RH improvisation)

    2. add forward motion - more syncopation

Embellishment notes:

articles.title: 2024 March
articles.content:
Topics

  • music

    • practice

    • study

  • habits maintaining

    • meditation

    • cooking

    • exercise

  • relationship

  • interesting events

  • Thought of life

Music:

Exams: March is the mid-term exam month in Berklee, I had in total 8 mid-term writing & performance exams. The results will be out in April, I expect all A (grading from 90-100). In case you are wondering what are the music courses I am doing. Here are the answers: Harmony level 3, Ear training level 2, Arranging level 1, Ensemble jazz band, Private piano lesson, Piano Comping level 2, KeyboardÂ Bass techniques, Enaging with Boston, and Unreal literature (magic realism, surrealism, sci-fi and so on)

Recordings: As a pianist in a big jazz band - JSMU (Jazz and Social Music Universe), we recorded from 9 am to 9 pm in Boston Record studio and finished recording 9 songs. First time in a big band, so much fun. I attached one audio in the attachment in case you want to listen.Â 

Piano practice: update my daily practice routine to the following:

Techniques (MUST SING):

  • Scales

  • ArpeggiosÂ 

  • Singing & play

    • Singing relative do, 4 notes,Â Left hand 15; Right hand: play the 4 notes

  • Chords & chord arpeggios: C first, then weeks key

    • 3 notes chord & 2 inversions (30m)

    • 4 notes chord (7 chords) & 3 inversions (30m)

    • 5 types of 7 chords, starting from -7b5 & diminished (20m)

    • 5 types of 9, 13 chords, starting from -7b5 & diminished (15m)

  • Chord progression (first LH only, then RH, then circle of fifth, LH â†’ RH)

    • 7 chords - 5 types, start from half-diminished, then diminished, then dominant (20m)

    • 9th & 13th chords - start from half-diminished, then diminished, then AB position dominant (do it after 2 days of 7 chord practice)

  • 7 modes in week's key (natural minor, Dorian & Lydian ), C,G,F

    • General

      • 3 notes chord & 2 inversions ï¼ˆ20mï¼‰

      • 4 notes chord (7 chords) & 3 inversions ï¼ˆ30m)

      • triplet - ascending & descending (3m)

    • if its a dorian, for example, B dorian, than play the following chord progression pattern

      • 1, 9, 11, 5: 4 stack chord (also 3 notes) & 2 inversions - watch the Pat playing video (10m)

    • if its a lydian

      • 9, 3, 6: 4 stack chord (also 3 notes) & 2 inversions

  • C all the minors (natural minor, melodic minor, harmonic minor, dorian, phrygian) (3m)

  • scales (all keys practice and SING) (10m)

    • half step (chromatic) up, descending onlyÂ  & ascending only

    • half step (chromatic) down, descending onlyÂ  & ascending only

    • 534231271 pattern

  • Voicing & other chord progression practice (all key)

    • Triads (3m)

      • major, minor, dimished, augmented

    • Shell voicingÂ 

    • 251 workout:

      • guide tone

      • close position

      • A position voicing

      • B position voicing

    • simple form blues (Sing melody then play):

      • Ireal pro:

        • comping: guide tone only

        • solo: blues scale

Song practice

  • someday my prince will come & autumn leaves (MUST SING)

    • practice single chord by chord

      • LH repeated walking bass

      • RH different comping voicing: 9,13th for dominant, & 4 stacks

    • LH walking bass + RH melody

    • LH walking bass + RH comping

  • my foolish heart (memorize 1 page everyday)

  • new song every week (blue monk)

Habits maintaining:

  • meditation: 30mins in the morning & 30min before sleeping

  • cooking: One new cuisine each week, cook 2 days a week

  • exercise: 3 times a week - indoor/outdoor jogging & gym

Relationship:

Family: share photos/video of my daily life in family group chat. video chat with my family when I have free time

Girlfriend: 1 hour of meditation sitting together online via video chat daily. Also, watch movie together online and plan the future every now and then

Intimate circle friends: Video chat with YZX, LG, LYH, WT, QYQ, JK, WYZ

Event:

Berklee keys festival. I attended a few piano master classes and met some Gram

articles.title: Berklee Piano Practice Record
articles.content:
30mins

Technique (scales, chord progressions)Â 

  • Hannon in week's key (1 piece each day)

  • pedal for progression . Say it out : d major, first inversion, third in the bottom, put it down faster for next chord

  • Scales -Â 

    • half step (chromatic) up, descending onlyÂ  & ascending only

    • half step (chromatic) down, descending onlyÂ  & ascending only

    • 534231271 pattern

  • chord arpeggios (major)

    • 3 notes chord & 2 inversions

    • 4 notes chord (7 chords) & 3 inversions

  • 7 modes in week's key (Dorian & lydian )

    • General

      • 3 notes chord & 2 inversions

      • 4 notes chord (7 chords) & 3 inversions

      • triplet - ascending & decsending

    • if its a dorian

      • 1, 9, 11, 5: 4 stack chord (also 3 notes) & 2 inversions

    • if its a lydian

      • 9, 3, 6: 4 stack chord (also 3 notes) & 2 inversions

  • C all the minors (natural minor, melodic minor, harmonic minor, dorian, phrygian)

30mins

Start from dimished chord

Start from B

Circle of fifth, start from left hand

chords in golden area (left hand root note & chords)

Say it out. C minus 7 flat5, 2nd inversion, Fifth in the bottom.Â 

Left hand, chord and one note.Â 

  • P1, D [RH, LH]

    • Maj, r123

    • Dom,r123

    • Min,r123

    • -7b5,r123 *

    • Dim,r123 *

    • å·¦æ‰‹ root, 5th, å³æ‰‹ 9 13

    • RH - dominantÂ  9for 1, 13 for 5.Â 

    • RH - maj, lydian 4 stack

    • RH - minor, dorian 4 stack

  • P2 [RH, LH] voice leading, left hand chord also.Â 

    • Maj, D,G,C. r123

    • Dom, D,G,C. r123

    • Min, D,G,C. r123

    • M7b5, D,G,C. r123 *

    • Diminished, D,G,C. r123 **

10 mins

HR3

  • different mode & minors in C. parrelel. thinking about the tensions.Â 

  • play the example in the books for standrard deceptive resolutionÂ 

20 mins

bass techniques (lady bird)

  • 10 mins

    • 8 flat blues V2

    • bass pattern (1581, 1561, 158+ leading tones of next chord) 3 exercisesÂ 

  • 10 mins

    • blues for alice (write the bass line) - ghost notes & triplet

    • road song 158+ leading tones of next chord

      • LH: bass pattern

      • RH: Pat voicingÂ 

  • 30minsÂ 

    • mid term exam

      • black orpheus

      • autumn leaves

40 mins

comping

  • 10 mins:Â 

    • 12 bars blues comping, RH comping

      • closed position

      • drop1, 5 position

  • 5 mins

    • Triads on 4 types in that week Key (weekly)

  • 15 mins:

    • Diatonic 7th chords in that week Key (weekly)

    • Diatonic 7th chords drop x series (all weekly)

    • Diatonic triads in that week Key (weekly)

  • 10 mins:

    • comping lesson song (e.b., watermelon man)

    • blues a whileÂ 

      • LH + RH melody

      • LH comping (5 types)

        • closed

        • guide toneÂ 

        • 9, 3, 5, 7

        • 9, 3, 13, 7

      • LH single notes + RH soloÂ 

    • Duke elington song with different voicing

15 mins

  • final: some day my prince will come

  • 2.22 solo idea practice - target each phrase to the 3rd & 7th

    • use triplet, 16th and 8th

    • use arpeggios,Â 

      • single chord arpeggios

      • connecting using the different inversions

    • have the RH the right hand form of the chord, and play1, then 2, then 3 notes of the chords

      • using different inversions - play it very slow, without metronone first

    • forwarding the Right hand chord to have tension -> resolve.Â 

  • 2.25

    • use the upper triad for comping!

    • use the pat voicing for comping

articles.title: Endorsement
articles.content:
Short Description of achievements since previous endorsement:

â—Â Â Â Â Â  Through mining operation we were able to reduce short term and long term cost significantly by moving to data centre

â—Â Â Â Â Â  Securing service contract with Belgium and American clients generating revenue of

â—Â Â Â Â Â  Obtaining an investment of 250k from a private investor

â—Â Â Â Â Â  Recruited two interns

â—Â Â Â Â Â  Expanded the team with a new cofounder specialised in strategy

â—Â Â Â Â Â  Successfully conducted research and adapted trading strategy for the evolving market

Short description of the applicantâ€™s role in the business:

Leading investor relation management and looking for potential investors and developing business opportunities as well as being responsible for business function including working with accountant and lawyers, managing company accounts, organising company documents and alike.

Short Description of achievements since previous endorsement:

  • The business is registered with Companies House with number 12131845.

  • The firm has researched and developed two major iterations of its core trading infrastructure and systems to achieve industry leading latency and market connectivity. The firm works closely with major crypto exchanges including Binance, OKX, http://Crypto.com and prime broker LTP to provide market data and trading infrastructure for both buy side and sell side market participants in the crypto ecosystem. The firm developed its latest generation trading system with market coverage to include non-traditional venues in decentralized finance (DeFi).

  • The firm established two partnerships to date for its crypto trading operation with proprietary trading firms. The firm provided market making as a service in its first partnership with Ledbest LTD (10803626), a UK based crypto trading proprietary firm, between 2020 and 2022. The firm is providing its trading infrastructure and system as a service in its current partnership with Thanefield Capital Limited (2091816), a British Virgin Island based proprietary trading firm. The firm managed to maximize the value of its trading capabilities by leveraging the funds provided by partners while minimizing shareholder exposure to short term market fluctuations. The firm is in the process of onboarding Keyrock S.A. (0685.795.245), a Belgium based crypto market maker, and expect to finalize the partnership by Q1 2024.

  • The firm developed two new business lines â€“ crypto mining and decentralized application development and invested over 400,000 GBP in building its own computing infrastructure in the UK.

  • The firmâ€™s crypto mining operation generated over 180,000 GBP in revenue with the sale of crypto mining capacity to international crypto miners. Through the establishment of its crypto mining business line, the firm is hosting and maintaining a large computing cluster with over 2,000 vCPU cores in a datacenter outside Glasgow. This critical piece of infrastructure provides 24/7 computational support for the firmâ€™s crypto trading operation with in-house built data ingestion and machine learning pipelines that constantly generate trading and risk models for all active trading venues.

  • The firm researched and developed a business plan and its source code prototype for a decentralized e-commerce platform in the participation of the first hackathon for the Chia Blockchain. The firm won Third Prize in the hackathon and received 30,000 USD in prize money and seed funding.

  • The firm weathered through macroeconomic challenges brought by the COVID pandemic global market meltdown, and its risk management practices minimized the impact of industry black swan events like the implosion of FTX.

  • The firm achieved positive cashflow in 2023 and expects to double its revenue in 2024.

Short description of the applicantâ€™s role in the business:

Meiling Wang was appointed as Director of the Company, responsible for business development and management, client relations, legal, financial and risk management.
